intro: Myosotis rakiura, commonly known as the Stewart Island forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often prostrate or upright depending on the habitat. Myosotis rakiura is an important component of the local flora and is adapted to the unique climate of Stewart Island.
